title: What is the difference between Ibn Arabi and Ibn Al-Arabi? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, by Ibn Arabi everyone means the famous sufi scholar,  (Ibn Arabi) He was an early 13th century scholar mainly famous for his works with Islamic sufism philosophy. He is from Al-Andalus. Modern day Spain. Ibn Arabi - Wikipedia And I guess Ibn Al-Arabi refers mostly to Abu Bakr Ibn Al-Arabi who was also an Islamic scholar and from Al-Andalus but he was a Qadhi, judge. He was also interested in sufism but unlike Ibn Arabi he didn’t contribute, I mean diverted much into Islamic mysticism (sufism). He is not much famous like Ibn Arabi, the philosopher. Abu Bakr ibn al-Arabi - Wikipedia
“What is the difference between Ibn Arabi and Ibn Al-Arabi?” One was a pious scholar of Islam and the other was a deviant scholar of kalaam.
